channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Decision looms on moving to alert level two
item.description: A decision on whether to move to alert level 2 will be announced tomorrow and while businesses are keen, a public health expert says there is no evidence to support the move.

item.title: Covid-19: Police say most people sticking to level 3 restrictions this weekend
item.description: Police believe that people have been in general sticking to the alert level 3 restrictions this weekend.

item.title: Anti-freedom camping petition withdrawn after violent threats
item.description: An anti-freedom camping activist has withdrawn a petition to ban the practice, after receiving several threats of violence.

item.title: Two new confirmed cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand
item.description: There have been another two new confirmed cases of Covid-19 reported in New Zealand today, the Ministry of Health has revealed.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates for 10 May
item.description: Ninety-two percent of all confirmed and probable cases of Covid-19 have now recovered, according to the Health Ministry. See how the all the latest developments unfolded today with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Plasma from recovered Covid-19 patients collected for antibodies
item.description: The Blood Service is collecting plasma from recovered Covid-19 patients, to help other people fight off the virus.

item.title: Police investigate death in Tokoroa
item.description: One person has died at a residential address in Tokoroa in south Waikato this afternoon.

item.title: Work and Income wrong on benefits and redundancies for decades
item.description: Work and Income appears to have spent decades wrongly advising some benefit applicants that they cannot get support until their redundancy has run out.

item.title: Covid-19 lockdown could lead to baby boom
item.description: The Covid-19 lockdown could lead to a boom in pregnancies as some people have more sex while at home, but not everyone is busier in the bedroom, Family Planning says.

item.title: Driver dies after colliding with horse
item.description: A person is dead after a car struck a horse in eastern Bay of Plenty last night.

item.title: Government pulls forward biosecurity, conservation projects to provide work
item.description: The government has pushed forward 55 biosecurity and conservation projects to provide work for up to 160 people who've lost their jobs during the lockdown.

item.title: Covid-19: What happened in New Zealand and around the world on 9 May
item.description: New Zealand reported two new cases of Covid-19 on Saturday, but a just-released document says the country could remain in alert levels 2 and 3 for years.

item.title: Pilots ask for tax relief to help those who have lost jobs
item.description: Pilots made redundant in the Covid-19 outbreak say the government needs to consider tax relief for many like them who cannot access the benefit.

item.title: Wellington Water calls on council to relax performance targets
item.description: Wellington's water contractor suggested the Wellington City Council might like to relax some of the performance targets for its pipe network if it wanted the contractor to start meeting them.

item.title: Increase in bird life during lockdown may be lost once people return
item.description: Ornithologists believe birds - which have been more visible in parks and public spaces - could abandon them once people start to come back.

item.title: Alert levels two and three could be in place for 'moderate amount of time'
item.description: New Zealand could remain in alert levels 2 and 3 for a "moderate amount of time" even if infection prevention and control continue, according to an official document.

item.title: Two new cases of Covid-19 linked to St Margarets cluster
item.description: There have been two new cases of Covid-19 reported in NZ today, both linked to the St Margarets cluster in Auckland.

item.title: Construction starts up again at public housing work sites
item.description: Builders are back in business as the construction of state houses and affordable homes ramps up again.
